positive.review: A great Utility especially for social VR
cool thing on my hand very nice
Literally OVRToolkit but better. Looks nicer, runs nicely. I was a big ovrt defender but I finally tried this in 2022 and I haven't gone back since.

XSOverlay is love, XSOverlay is life
Spread the gospel to those OVR Toolkit heretics.

I've heard OVR Toolkit had spyware or smth like that, tbh even if it doesnt id still rather use this, looks cleaner and not as much clutter as OVR (for the people that might think im slandering OVR without using it, yes i have used OVR in the past, while it is better for more advanced stuff, i feel like XSOverlay is more towards simplicity without much in between). 10/10 for simple yet effective VR overlay

PS: turns out some people had their OVR flagged as a "trojan", plus the new UI is bad, that's why

XSOverlay is an amazing Add-On for VRChat.
I don't have many comments on it, I just think it's insanely useful.

A valuable tool for VR. Being able to access your desktops and pin desktop apps in VR comes in handy in many ways. Even just having the wrist overlay with media controls and clock is something that I will always need at hand (pun intended). Combined with VRCX, you can get notifications for VRChat in the overlay.
it's good, bugs sometimes, but it works and is a great overlay and watch. especially since most headset huds are coinflips if they work or not
pretty cool and useful for vrchat
A great Utility especially for social VR
definitly good for extra activities in games
cool thing on my hand very nice
Good overlay
good overlay
It works :3
yes
yes

negative.review:
This program is great and all, but it breaks itself every few months. I have to go into the files and delete all data associated to fix this app every now and then. 

Needs to be 3 dollars if they can't fix it, kinda frustrating that this product is still $9.99 despite breaking consistently in the same fashion.
it's okay.
there is absolutely 0 (zero) reason why an overlay should ever need to occupy 12+ GB of VRAM after moderate use or one desktop window being opened

This program is great and all, but it breaks itself every few months. I have to go into the files and delete all data associated to fix this app every now and then. 

Needs to be 3 dollars if they can't fix it, kinda frustrating that this product is still $9.99 despite breaking consistently in the same fashion.

Not great, OVR Toolkit is way more usefull, the screen keep freezing and keep have to use my actual mouse and keyboard while looking under my headset on my screen, also would love to see a timer or alarm feature built in and pls add a way to up the size on the watch, in my opinion I can bearly see the time if I don't really focus on the watch, for not no reason to get XSOverlay over OVR Toolkit in my opinion, also the keyboard just straight up does not work at all no matter what I try to fix it

Good idea, but it just doesn't work reliably. All I need is to see a browser window while inside another VR game. When it works, it works great. However, it rarely just works and I end up quitting/restarting, deleting the config file (as is recommended to the many other people experiencing the same kind of issue), rebooting, etc. until it finally works. By then, I'm annoyed I've spent so much time troubleshooting rather than playing and swear one day I'll leave a review and buy the other software that does it. After another fight with it, today is that day.
Doesn't work anymore.
it's okay.
there is absolutely 0 (zero) reason why an overlay should ever need to occupy 12+ GB of VRAM after moderate use or one desktop window being opened

it's okay.
there is absolutely 0 (zero) reason why an overlay should ever need to occupy 12+ GB of VRAM after moderate use or one desktop window being opened

This program is great and all, but it breaks itself every few months. I have to go into the files and delete all data associated to fix this app every now and then. 

Needs to be 3 dollars if they can't fix it, kinda frustrating that this product is still $9.99 despite breaking consistently in the same fashion.

Not great, OVR Toolkit is way more usefull, the screen keep freezing and keep have to use my actual mouse and keyboard while looking under my headset on my screen, also would love to see a timer or alarm feature built in and pls add a way to up the size on the watch, in my opinion I can bearly see the time if I don't really focus on the watch, for not no reason to get XSOverlay over OVR Toolkit in my opinion, also the keyboard just straight up does not work at all no matter what I try to fix it

Good idea, but it just doesn't work reliably. All I need is to see a browser window while inside another VR game. When it works, it works great. However, it rarely just works and I end up quitting/restarting, deleting the config file (as is recommended to the many other people experiencing the same kind of issue), rebooting, etc. until it finally works. By then, I'm annoyed I've spent so much time troubleshooting rather than playing and swear one day I'll leave a review and buy the other software that does it.
